p: PLCγ2 belongs to the same interaction network as TREM2 [ 6] and may be directly involved in its signaling pathway [ 15, 16]. TREM2 is a transmembrane receptor expressed on the membrane of myeloid cells and an important susceptibility gene for AD [ 5]. In osteoclasts, activation downstream Trem2 initiates a cascade of events, including phosphorylation and activation of PLCγ2, amongst other proteins [ 17]. In microglia, these pathways promote several cellular responses including survival, proliferation, phagocytosis, enhanced secretion of cytokines, and chemokines [ 18] and are potentially involved in neurodegenerative processes.
